skill.name: theme-factory
skill.description: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides, docs, reportings, HTML landing pages, etc. There are 10 pre-set themes with colors/fonts that you can apply to any artifact that has been creating, or can generate a new theme on-the-fly.
skill.summary: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides, docs, reportings, HTML la...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill containing only static theme definitions in markdown format with color palettes and font specifications. No executable code, scripts, or external dependencies present.

content.value_statement: Instantly apply professional color palettes and font combinations to your presentations, documents, and HTML artifacts with 10 curated themes or generate custom ones on demand.
actual_capabilities: Apply 10 pre-designed professional themes with coordinated colors and fonts
Display visual theme showcase PDF for easy selection
Generate custom themes on-the-fly based on user requirements
Provide complete theme specifications including hex codes and font pairings
Style various artifact types: slides, documents, reports, HTML pages
limitations: Limited to DejaVu Sans, DejaVu Serif, FreeSans, and FreeSerif font families
Requires manual application of theme specifications to artifacts
Cannot automatically detect or suggest themes based on content analysis
Theme showcase requires PDF viewing capability

use_cases.title: Professional Presentation Styling
use_cases.description: Apply cohesive color schemes and typography to corporate slide decks for consistent, polished presentations
use_cases.target_user: Business professionals, consultants, and corporate presenters

use_cases.title: Brand-Aligned Document Design
use_cases.description: Select or create custom themes matching brand guidelines for reports, proposals, and documentation
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams, designers, and brand managers

use_cases.title: Quick Visual Refresh
use_cases.description: Transform existing artifacts with new professional themes to update their look and feel instantly
use_cases.target_user: Content creators, educators, and knowledge workers

use_cases.title: Industry-Specific Styling
use_cases.description: Choose themes tailored for specific industries like healthcare, tech, hospitality, or environmental sectors

prompt_templates.title: Browse and Apply Theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the available themes and help me apply one to my presentation deck
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have an existing artifact that needs professional styling

prompt_templates.title: Custom Theme Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom theme for my [industry/brand] with [color preferences] that conveys [desired mood]
prompt_templates.scenario: When none of the 10 preset themes fit your specific needs

prompt_templates.title: Industry-Specific Theme
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm creating a presentation for [industry]. Which theme would work best?
prompt_templates.scenario: When seeking guidance on theme selection for specific contexts

prompt_templates.title: Theme Application to Multiple Artifacts
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the [theme name] theme to all my slides, keeping the styling consistent across the deck
prompt_templates.scenario: When applying consistent styling across multiple pages or artifacts

output_examples.output: Displays theme-showcase.pdf with visual examples of all 10 themes: Ocean Depths, Sunset Boulevard, Forest Canopy, Modern Minimalist, Golden Hour, Arctic Frost, Desert Rose, Tech Innovation, Botanical Garden, and Midnight Galaxy

output_examples.input: Apply the Ocean Depths theme to my presentation
output_examples.output: Applies Deep Navy (#1a2332) backgrounds, Teal (#2d8b8b) accents, Seafoam (#a8dadc) highlights, and Cream (#f1faee) text with DejaVu Sans Bold headers and DejaVu Sans body text

output_examples.input: Create a warm, inviting theme for a restaurant presentation
output_examples.output: Generates a custom theme similar to Golden Hour with warm, appetizing colors and appropriate font pairings, shows it for review, then applies it to the artifact

best_practices: Always show the theme showcase PDF first to let users make informed visual choices
Wait for explicit theme selection confirmation before applying
Ensure proper color contrast and readability when applying themes
Maintain theme consistency across all slides and elements in an artifact
Consider the presentation context and audience when recommending themes
Review custom-generated themes with users before application
anti_patterns: Don't modify the theme-showcase.pdf file - it's for viewing only
Don't apply themes without user confirmation
Don't mix multiple themes within a single artifact
Don't skip showing available options when users are unfamiliar with the themes
Don't create custom themes when existing ones clearly fit the use case

faq.question: How many themes are available?
faq.answer: There are 10 pre-designed themes, each with unique color palettes and font pairings. You can also request custom themes generated on-the-fly based on your specific needs.

faq.question: What types of artifacts can I style with these themes?
faq.answer: The themes can be applied to presentation slides, documents, reports, HTML landing pages, and other visual artifacts.

faq.question: Can I customize the existing themes?
faq.answer: While the 10 preset themes have fixed specifications, you can request a custom theme that incorporates your specific color preferences, industry requirements, or brand guidelines.

faq.question: Which theme is best for corporate presentations?
faq.answer: Ocean Depths and Modern Minimalist are excellent for professional corporate contexts. Ocean Depths works well for financial and consulting content, while Modern Minimalist suits tech and design presentations.

faq.question: What fonts are available in these themes?
faq.answer: The themes use DejaVu Sans, DejaVu Serif, FreeSans, and FreeSerif font families in regular and bold weights for headers and body text.

dependencies: Theme definition files in themes/ directory
